detaileddescription.para: Bit 0 Deletion of this object is permitted
Bit 1 Execution of this object is permitted
Bit 2 Reading this object is permitted
Bit 3 Writing data to this object is permitted

briefdescription.para: Bit 4 Appending data to this object is permitted.

para.verbatim: Appending data increases its Allocated Size.

detaileddescription.para: Bit 5 Truncation of this object is permitted

briefdescription.para: Bit 6 Patching this object is permitted.

para.verbatim: Patching this object overwrites some of the object's existing contents.

detaileddescription.para: Bit 7 This object is a marked object
Bit 0 OACP Create Op Code Supported
Bit 1 OACP Delete Op Code Supported
Bit 2 OACP Calculate Checksum Op Code Supported
Bit 3 OACP Execute Op Code Supported
Bit 4 OACP Read Op Code Supported
Bit 5 OACP Write Op Code Supported
Bit 6 Appending Additional Data to Objects Supported
Bit 7 Truncation of Objects Supported
Bit 8 Patching of Objects Supported
Bit 9 OACP Abort Op Code Supported

briefdescription.para: Object Action Control Point Feature bits.

detaileddescription.para: Bit 0 OLCP Go To Op Code Supported
Bit 1 OLCP Order Op Code Supported
Bit 2 OLCP Request Number of Objects Op Code Supported
Bit 3 OLCP Clear Marking Op Code Supported

briefdescription.para: Object List Control Point Feature bits.
Add an object to the OTS instance.

detaileddescription.para: This function adds an object to the OTS database. When the object is being added, a callback obj_created() is called to notify the user about a new object ID.

simplesect.para: ID of created object in case of success.
negative value in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Delete an object from the OTS instance.

detaileddescription.para: This function deletes an object from the OTS database. When the object is deleted a callback obj_deleted() is called to notify the user about this event. At this point, it is possible to free allocated buffer for object data.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the object to be deleted (uint48).

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This function is enabled for CONFIG_BT_OTS_SECONDARY_SVC configuration. The first service attribute can be included in any other GATT service.

simplesect.para: 0 in case of success or negative value in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Get a free instance of OTS from the pool.

simplesect.para: OTS instance in case of success or NULL in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Converts binary OTS Object ID to string.

parameterdescription.para: Address of user buffer with enough room to store formatted string containing binary Object ID.
Length of data to be copied to user string buffer. Refer to BT_OTS_OBJ_ID_STR_LEN about recommended value.

simplesect.para: Number of successfully formatted bytes from binary ID.

briefdescription.para: Size of OTS object ID (in bytes).
Minimum allowed value for object ID (except ID for directory listing)
Maximum allowed value for object ID (except ID for directory listing)
ID of the Directory Listing Object.
Mask for OTS object IDs, preserving the 48 bits.
Length of OTS object ID string (in bytes).

detaileddescription.para: [Experimental] Users should note that the APIs can change as a part of ongoing development.
